tit.cmt: タイトルなので説明括弧を削除しました。下の行に補足しました。

sen.j: 大晦日（おおみそか）は、1年の最後の日。
sen.e: "Omisoka" means the last day of a year.
Omisoka means the last day of the year.
"Omisoka" (New Year's Eve) means the last day of a year.
sen.cmt: 説明括弧を補足しました。

sen.j: 天保暦(旧暦)など日本の太陰太陽暦では12月30日 (旧暦)、または12月29日 (旧暦)である。
sen.e: Under the Japanese lunisolar calendar such as Tenpo-reki (Tenpo calendar,) omisoka corresponds to December 30 or 29, both under the lunar calendar.
Under Japanese lunisolar calendars such as the Tenpo-reki (the Tenpo calendar), Omisoka is either December 30 (lunar calendar) or 29 (lunar calendar).
sen.cmt: Removed "the", added "s", added "the", moved comma outside parentheses, changed "corresponds to" to "is either", changed "30 or 29, both under the lunar calendar" to "30 (lunar calendar) or 29 (lunar calendar).".
sen.e: Under Japanese lunisolar calendars such as the Tenpo-reki (the Tenpo calendar), Omisoka is either December 30 (lunar calendar) or 29 (lunar calendar).

sen.j: 現在のグレゴリオ暦(新暦)では12月31日。
sen.e: It is equivalent to December 31 in the current Gregorian calendar (solar calendar.)
Under the current Gregorian calendar (a solar calendar), it falls on December 31.
sen.cmt: Changed word order, changed "It is equivalent to" to "it falls on", changed "Under" to "in", inserted "a".
sen.e: Under the current Gregorian calendar (a solar calendar), it falls on December 31.

sen.j: 大つごもりともいう。
sen.e: Omisoka is also called "otsugomori"("Hogmanay.")
Omisoka is also called "otsugomori".
sen.cmt: Removed "Hogmanay" (only celebrated in Scotland, and not applicable in context).
sen.e: Omisoka is also called "otsugomori."
sen.cmt: ピリオド位置を訂正しました。

sen.j: 日本では、年神を迎えることにちなむ行事が行われる。
sen.e: On that occasion, various events are held to welcome toshigami (the god of incoming year) in Japan.
In Japan, various events are held to welcome the toshigami (the god of the incoming year).
sen.cmt: Replaced "On that occasion" with "In Japan", added "the" and "the", removed "in Japan from end of sentence.
sen.e: In Japan, various events are held to welcome the toshigami (the god of the incoming year).

sen.j: 旧暦では毎月の最終日を晦日（みそか）といった。
sen.e: Under the lunar calendar, the last day of each month was called "misoka."
Under the lunar calendar, the last day of each month was called "misoka."
Under the lunar calendar, the last day of each month was called "misoka."

sen.j: 晦日のうち、年内で最後の晦日、つまり12月（または閏月12月）の晦日を大晦日といった。
sen.e: Among these misoka days, the last one in a year, i.e. the last day of December (or intercalary twelfth month) was referred to as omisoka.
Of these misoka days, the last one in a year - in other words, the last day of December (or the intercalary twelfth month) - was referred to as "Omisoka".
sen.cmt: Changed "Among" to "Of", inserted dashes, inserted "the", put quote marks around and capitalized "Omisoka".
sen.e: Of these misoka days, the last one in a year - in other words, the last day of December (or the intercalary twelfth month) - was referred to as "Omisoka."
sen.cmt: ピリオド位置を訂正しました。

sen.j: もともと“みそ”は“三十”であり、“みそか”は30日の意味だった。
sen.e: Originally, "miso" meant "thirty" and "misoka"had a meaning of "the thirtieth day."
Originally, "miso" meant "thirty", and "misoka"meant "the thirtieth day."
sen.cmt: Inserted comma, changed "had a meaning of" to "meant".
sen.e: Originally, "miso" meant "thirty," and "misoka" meant "the thirtieth day."
sen.cmt: コンマ位置を訂正しました。スペースを補足しました。

sen.j: ただし、月の大小が年によって変動するので、実際には29日のこともあった。
sen.e: However, misoka could happen to be twenty-nineth day of a month, due to variation of the number of days of a month according to years.
However, misoka could fall on the twenty-ninth day of a month, due to the varying number of days per month in different years.
sen.cmt: Replaced "happen to be" with "fall", corrected "-nineth" to "-ninth", changed "variation of the number of days of a month according to years" to "the varying number of days per month in different years".
sen.e: However, misoka could fall on the 29th day of a month, due to the varying number of days per month in different years.

sen.j: 現在は、新暦の12月31日を指す。
sen.e: Today, omisoka refers to December 31 under the solar calendar.
Today, under the solar calendar, Omisoka refers to December 31.
sen.cmt: Changed phrase order, added comma, capitalized "Omisoka".
sen.e: Today, under the solar calendar, Omisoka refers to December 31.

sen.j: 大晦日を大つごもりともいった。
sen.e: Omisoka is also called "otsugomori."
Omisoka is also called "otsugomori."
Omisoka is also called "otsugomori."

sen.j: 「つごもり」は、晦日の別名であり、「月隠り（つきごもり）」が転じたものである。
sen.e: "Tsugomori" is the term modified from "tsuki-gomori" (literally, "hiding moon") and is synonymous with "misoka."
The term "Tsugomori" was modified from "tsuki-gomori" (literally, "hiding moon") and is synonymous with "misoka."
sen.cmt: Changed "'Tsugomori' is the term modified" to "The term 'Tsugomori' was modified".
sen.e: The term 'Tsugomori' was modified from 'tsuki-gomori' (literally, "hiding moon") and is synonymous with 'misoka.'
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。

tit.cmt: Changed word order, capitalized both words.

sen.j: 大晦日には、様々な年越しの行事が行われる。
sen.e: On the day of omisoka, various events are held to see out the old year.
On Omisoka, various events are held to see out the old year.
On Omisoka, various events are held to see out the old year.

sen.j: 年越しの夜のことを除夜（じょや）とも言う。
sen.e: The night of omisoka for seeing the old year out is also called "joya."
The night when the old year is seen out is also called "joya."
sen.cmt: Removed "of omisoka", changed "for seeing the old year" to "when the old year is seen".
sen.e: The night when the old year is seen out is also called "joya."

sen.j: かつては、除夜は年神を迎えるために一晩中起きている習わしがあり、この夜に早く寝ると白髪になるとか、皴が寄るとかいった俗信があった。
sen.e: Formerly, people used to stay awake during the night of joya to welcome the god of incoming year, believing in a superstition that they might get gray hair or wrinkles if they would go to bed at an early hour of the night.

Formerly, people used to stay awake during the night of joya to welcome the god of the incoming year, due to a superstition that they might get gray hair or wrinkles if they went to bed at an early hour that night.
sen.cmt: Inserted "the", changed "believing in" to "due to", changed "would go" to "went", changed "of the" to "that".
sen.e: Formerly, people used to stay awake during the night of joya to welcome the god of the incoming year, due to a superstition that they might get gray hair or wrinkles if they went to bed at an early hour that night.

sen.j: 大晦日の伝統的な風習には以下のようなものがある。
sen.e: Followings are the traditional customs observed on omisoka:
The following are traditional customs observed on Omisoka:
The following are traditional customs observed on Omisoka:

sen.j: 年越し蕎麦（地方によっては他の食事)
sen.e: Toshikoshi-soba (buckwheat noodles eaten on New Year's Eve)
Toshikoshi-soba (buckwheat noodles eaten on New Year's Eve)
Toshikoshi-soba (buckwheat noodles eaten on New Year's Eve)

sen.j: 除夜の鐘
sen.e: Joya no Kane (bells ringing out the old year)
Joya no Kane (bells ringing out the old year)
Joya no Kane (bells ringing out the old year)

sen.j: 二年参り（初詣）
sen.e: Ninen-mairi or hatsu-mode (the practice of visiting a shrine or temple at the beginning of the New Year)
Ninen-mairi or hatsu-mode (the practice of visiting a shrine or temple at the beginning of the new year)
Ninen-mairi or hatsu-mode (the practice of visiting a shrine or temple at the beginning of the new year)

tit.e: Events on omisoka in different regions:

sen.j: なまはげ（秋田県男鹿市）
sen.e: Namahage (Oga City, Akita Prefecture) (folklore demons of the Oga Peninsula that pay freightening visits to children at the New Year)
Namahage (Oga City, Akita Prefecture) (folkloric demons of the Oga Peninsula that pay frightening visits to children on New Year's.)
sen.cmt: Changed "folklore" to "folkloric", corrected "freightening" to "frightening", changed "at the New Year" to "on New Year's".
sen.e: Namahage (Oga City, Akita Prefecture) (folkloric demons of the Oga Peninsula that pay frightening visits to children on New Year's.)

sen.j: 大晦日は正月の一日前であることから、家族が全員そろっていることが多い。
sen.e: Since omisoka is the day just before the New Year, full members of a family gather together in many cases.
Since Omisoka is the day just before the new year, in many cases, entire families gather together.
sen.cmt: Capitalized "Omisoka", removed capitals from "new year", changed "full members of a family gather together in many cases" to "in many cases, entire families gather together".
sen.e: Since Omisoka is the day just before the new year, in many cases, entire families gather together.

sen.j: そのため、テレビ番組においては一家団欒をにらんでの目的で特別番組を多く編成しており、これも大晦日の風物詩となっている。
sen.e: Taking this opportunity, many special programs are aired on TV targeting happy family circles, which scene is now a charming feature of omisoka season.
For that reason, many special programs aimed at happy family circles are aired on TV, and are now a charming feature of the Omisoka season.
sen.cmt: Changed "Taking this opportunity" to "For that reason", changed "are aired on TV targeting happy family circles" to "aimed at happy family circles are aired on TV", changed "which scene is" to "and are", added "the", capitalized "Omisoka".
sen.e: For that reason, many special programs aimed at happy family circles are aired on TV, and are now a charming feature of the Omisoka season.

sen.j: 以下に、代表的なものを挙げる。
sen.e: Followings are the representative examples:
The following are representative examples:
The following are representative examples:

sen.j: NHK紅白歌合戦（日本放送協会NHK総合テレビジョン）
sen.e: NHK Kohaku Utagassen (NHK year-end grand song festival) (a general TV program aired by Japan Broadcasting Corporation, NHK)
NHK Kohaku Utagassen (the NHK year-end grand song festival) (a general TV program aired by the Japan Broadcasting Corporation, NHK)
NHK Kohaku Utagassen (the NHK year-end grand song festival) (a general TV program aired by the Japan Broadcasting Corporation, NHK)
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。

sen.j: ゆく年くる年（NHK総合）
sen.e: Yuku-toshi Kuru-toshi (the old year and the new year) (NHK's general TV program)
Yuku-toshi Kuru-toshi (the old year and the new year) (an NHK general TV program)
Yuku-toshi Kuru-toshi (the old year and the new year) (an NHK general TV program)

sen.j: にっぽんの歌（テレビ東京系）
sen.e: Nippon no Uta (songs of Japan) (affiliated to Television Tokyo)
Nippon no Uta (songs of Japan) (affiliated with Television Tokyo)
Nippon no Uta (songs of Japan) (affiliated with Television Tokyo)

sen.j: 東急ジルベスターコンサート（テレビ東京系）
sen.e: Tokyu Silvester Concert (affiliated to Television Tokyo)
Tokyu Silvester Concert (affiliated with Television Tokyo)
Tokyu Silvester Concert (affiliated with Television Tokyo)

sen.j: ドラえもん (1979年のテレビアニメ)（テレビ朝日系）
sen.e: Doraemon (name of a popular cartoon character on the animated TV program in 1979) (affiliated to Television Asahi)
Doraemon (the name of a popular cartoon character from a 1979 animated TV program) (affiliated with Television Asahi)
sen.cmt: Inserted "the", changed "on the" to "from a", changed "animated TV program in 1979" to "1979 animated TV program), replaced "to" with "with".
sen.e: Doraemon (the name of a popular cartoon character from a 1979 animated TV program) (affiliated with Television Asahi)

sen.j: 全国おもしろニュースグランプリ（テレビ朝日系）
sen.e: The Omoshiro News Grandprix (affiliated to Television Asahi)
The Omoshiro News Grandprix (affiliated with Television Asahi)
The Omoshiro News Grandprix (affiliated with Television Asahi)

sen.j: 格闘技イベント『K-1 PREMIUM Dynamite!!』（TBSテレビ系）
sen.e: The Combative Sport Event "K-1 PREMIUM Dynamite!!" (affiliated to TBS Television)
The Martial Arts Event "K-1 PREMIUM Dynamite!!" (affiliated with TBS Television)
sen.cmt: Changed "Combative Sport" to "Martial Arts", changed "to" to "with".
sen.e: The Martial Arts Event "K-1 PREMIUM Dynamite!!" (affiliated with TBS Television)

sen.j: 日本レコード大賞（TBS系）※2005年まで大晦日放送。
sen.e: THE JAPAN RECORD AWARD (affiliated to TBS Television,) which had been aired on every New Year's Eve until 2005, but changed to be broadcast on 30 December, every year since 2006.
THE JAPAN RECORD AWARD (affiliated with TBS Television), which aired on New Year's Eve until 2005.
sen.cmt: Changed "to" to "with", changed "had been aired" to "aired", removed "every", changed "changed to be broadcast on 30 December, every year" to "has been broadcast on December 30"
sen.e: THE JAPAN RECORD AWARD (affiliated with TBS Television), which aired on New Year's Eve until 2005.

sen.j: 2006年からは12月30日となった。
sen.e: Since 2006, it has been broadcast on December 30.
Since 2006, it has been broadcast on December 30.
Since 2006, it has been broadcast on December 30.

sen.j: Last Call with Carson Daly（NBC）
sen.e: Last Call with Carson Daly (NBC)
Last Call with Carson Daly (NBC)
Last Call with Carson Daly (NBC)

sen.j: Dick Clarks New Years Rockin Eve（アメリカン・ブロードキャスティング・カンパニー）
sen.e: Dick Clarks New Years Rockin' Eve (American Broadcasting Company)
Dick Clark's New Year's Rockin' Eve (American Broadcasting Company)
Dick Clark's New Year's Rockin' Eve (American Broadcasting Company)

tit.j: 大晦日を題材とした古典落語
tit.e: Koten Rakugo (classical comic storytelling) on the subject of omisoka:
Koten Rakugo (classical comic storytelling) on the subject of Omisoka:
Koten Rakugo (classical comic storytelling) on the subject of Omisoka

sen.j: 掛取萬歳
sen.e: Kaketori-manzai (title of a classical comic storytelling)
Kaketori-manzai (a classic comic story)
sen.cmt: Removed "title of", changed "classical comic storytelling" to "classic comic story".
sen.e: Kaketori-manzai (a classic comic story)

sen.j: 芝浜
sen.e: Shibahama (title of a classical comic storytelling)
Shibahama (a classic comic story)
sen.cmt: Removed "title of", changed "classical comic storytelling" to "classic comic story".
sen.e: Shibahama (a classic comic story)
